name: Deschutes River
description: The Deschutes River is a premier blue ribbon trout fishery in Central Oregon. This large tailwater river flows through high desert country and is famous for its native redband rainbow trout and brown trout.

accessPoints.name: Heritage Landing
accessPoints.description: At Columbia River confluence, popular for steelhead

accessPoints.name: Trout Creek
accessPoints.description: 9 miles below Pelton Dam, excellent wade fishing

accessPoints.name: Benham Falls
accessPoints.description: Scenic falls area with good fishing

regulations: No fishing from floating devices on the Deschutes River - wade fishing only. Always check ODFW regulations for current catch limits and seasons.

name: Crane Prairie Reservoir
description: Known as the 'Cascade Lake of the West,' Crane Prairie is famous for its large rainbow trout and excellent bass fishing. The reservoir has numerous channels and shallow areas.

accessPoints.name: Rocky Point Boat Ramp
accessPoints.description: Main boat launch with good parking

regulations: Standard Oregon fishing regulations apply. Boat fishing allowed. Check ODFW for trout size limits.

name: Wickiup Reservoir
description: Wickiup is the largest reservoir in the Cascade Lakes chain, known for excellent kokanee fishing and large brown trout. The reservoir has extensive shorelines and numerous bays.

accessPoints.name: North Wickiup Boat Ramp
accessPoints.description: Primary boat launch on north end

regulations: Kokanee limit is 5 per day. Check ODFW for current regulations on trout limits.

name: Metolius River
description: One of Oregon's most beautiful spring creeks, the Metolius flows crystal clear from underground springs. It's a challenging but rewarding fishery with native rainbow trout and bull trout.

accessPoints.name: Camp Sherman
accessPoints.description: Multiple access points near Camp Sherman store

regulations: Bull trout are protected - catch and release only. Fly fishing only in some sections. Check ODFW regulations for specific section rules.

name: Crooked River
description: The Crooked River below Bowman Dam is a excellent tailwater fishery with abundant redband rainbow trout and mountain whitefish. The river canyon provides spectacular scenery.

accessPoints.name: Bowman Dam
accessPoints.description: Below the dam, excellent fishing access

regulations: Trout limit is 5 per day, with only 1 over 20 inches. Artificial flies and lures only in some sections. Check ODFW regulations.

name: Cascade Lakes
description: The Cascade Lakes Highway provides access to numerous high mountain lakes, each with unique fishing opportunities. From trophy trout to kokanee, there's something for every angler.

accessPoints.name: Elk Lake
accessPoints.description: Easy access via Cascade Lakes Highway

accessPoints.name: Sparks Lake
accessPoints.description: Scenic high lake with good trout fishing

regulations: Regulations vary by lake. Hosmer Lake is fly fishing only. Check ODFW for lake-specific regulations.

name: Fall River
description: A pristine spring creek that flows into the Deschutes River. Fall River is known for its crystal-clear water and selective rainbow trout. Excellent dry fly fishing.
regulations: Fly fishing only. Catch and release encouraged. Check ODFW for current regulations.

name: Tumalo Creek
description: A beautiful mountain creek near Bend with native rainbow trout and brook trout in its upper reaches. Best fished in spring and early summer.

accessPoints.name: Shevlin Park
accessPoints.description: Easy access in Bend city limits

regulations: Check ODFW for creek-specific regulations. Some sections may be closed to protect spawning fish.
